description: Trapiche is a well-known Argentine winery, and their Malbec offers a good representation of the varietal, often characterized by rich fruit flavors and smooth tannins.
food_pairing: Grilled steak or beef burgers, Argentine empanadas or asado
appetizer_pairing: Grilled vegetable skewers with balsamic glaze

description: Catena Zapata is renowned for producing high-quality Malbec wines. Their Malbec often displays a balance of fruitiness, acidity, and structure, making it a favorite among Malbec enthusiasts.
food_pairing: Roasted lamb or beef stew, Dishes with chimichurri sauce

description: Bodega Norton's Malbec Reserva is a step up in quality, offering deeper complexity and aging potential. It showcases ripe fruit flavors, elegant oak integration, and a lingering finish, making it a great choice for those seeking a more refined Malbec experience.
food_pairing: Grilled ribeye steak or braised short ribs
appetizer_pairing: Crostini with fig jam and prosciutto, Hard cheeses like Manchego or aged cheddar

description: Beringer's Cabernet Sauvignon is a classic representation of California's Cabernet style, with bold flavors of black currant, cherry, and cedar, balanced by firm tannins and a long finish.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, beef stew, hearty red meat dishes

description: Kendall-Jackson's Pinot Noir showcases bright red fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry, along with hints of vanilla and spice. It offers a smooth texture and a silky finish.
food_pairing: Salmon, roasted chicken, mushroom risotto

description: Columbia Crest's Merlot is known for its approachable style, with soft tannins and flavors of plum, black cherry, and mocha. It pairs well with a variety of foods.
food_pairing: Grilled lamb chops, pasta with marinara sauce, mushroom pizza
appetizer_pairing: Stuffed mushrooms with sausage and cheese

description: Antinori's Chianti Classico is a classic Tuscan red wine with aromas of ripe cherries, violets, and spice. It has a medium body, firm tannins, and a long, persistent finish.
food_pairing: Margherita pizza, pasta with tomato sauce, grilled vegetables

description: Banfi's Brunello di Montalcino is a prestigious Italian wine, aged for several years before release. It features intense aromas of dark fruit, leather, and spice, with a robust structure and long aging potential.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, wild boar rag√π, aged cheeses
appetizer_pairing: Charcuterie board with cured meats and aged cheeses

description: Montes Carmenere is a flagship Chilean wine known for its deep red color and rich flavors of dark fruit, spice, and chocolate. It has a velvety texture and a long, smooth finish.
food_pairing: Grilled lamb chops, spicy beef dishes, mushroom risotto

description: Casilero del Diablo's Cabernet Sauvignon is a classic Chilean red wine with aromas of black currant, plum, and cedar. It offers rich fruit flavors, firm tannins, and a long, elegant finish.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, lamb chops, hearty stews

description: Tommasi Ripasso is a rich and velvety Italian red wine with aromas of dried fruits, spices, and tobacco. It undergoes a unique double fermentation process, resulting in enhanced complexity and depth of flavor.
food_pairing: Grilled meats, hearty pasta dishes, aged cheeses
appetizer_pairing: Antipasto platter with cured meats and olives

description: Peller Estates Cabernet Franc is a versatile Canadian red wine with aromas of red berries, tobacco, and spice. It has a medium body, smooth tannins, and a lingering finish.
food_pairing: Grilled sausages, roasted duck, mushroom risotto

description: Burrowing Owl Merlot is a well-balanced Canadian red wine with aromas of plum, blackberry, and vanilla. It has a smooth texture, ripe fruit flavors, and soft tannins.
food_pairing: Grilled pork tenderloin, pasta with marinara sauce, aged cheeses
appetizer_pairing: Stuffed mushrooms with goat cheese and herbs

description: Chianti is a classic Italian red wine from Tuscany, known for its medium body, bright acidity, and flavors of cherry, plum, and dried herbs. Its vibrant acidity helps cut through the richness of chicken alfredo, creating a balanced pairing.
food_pairing: Chicken alfredo, tomato-based pasta dishes, roasted pork
appetizer_pairing: Antipasto platter with cured meats and olives

description: Barbera d'Asti is a medium-bodied Italian red wine from the Piedmont region. It offers ripe fruit flavors of cherry and raspberry, along with lively acidity and soft tannins, making it a versatile match for spaghetti meatballs.
food_pairing: Spaghetti meatballs, grilled sausages, mushroom risotto
appetizer_pairing: Garlic bread with marinara dipping sauce

description: Nero d'Avola is a bold and fruity Italian red wine from Sicily. It features flavors of dark berries, plum, and spice, with a smooth texture and moderate tannins, complementing the hearty flavors of spaghetti and meatballs.
food_pairing: Spaghetti meatballs, pizza, grilled vegetables
appetizer_pairing: Arancini (Italian rice balls) with marinara sauce

description: Cloudy Bay Pinot Noir is a New Zealand wine with delicate flavors of red berries, earth, and spice. It offers a silky texture and a long, elegant finish.
food_pairing: Salmon, roasted chicken, mushroom risotto

description: Ravenswood Zinfandel is a California wine known for its bold flavors of blackberry, raspberry, and spice. It has a full body and smooth tannins, making it ideal for pairing with barbecue dishes.
food_pairing: Barbecue ribs, grilled burgers, spicy chili

description: Masseria Altemura Primitivo is an Italian red wine from Puglia, offering rich flavors of dark fruit, chocolate, and spice. It has a full body and smooth tannins, perfect for pairing with grilled meats and pasta dishes.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, hearty pasta dishes, aged cheeses
appetizer_pairing: Meatballs in marinara sauce, bruschetta with roasted garlic

description: Ch√¢teau Les Graves de Viaud Bordeaux is a classic French wine with flavors of black currant, cedar, and tobacco. It has firm tannins and a long, complex finish, making it a great match for grilled meats and hearty stews.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, lamb chops, hearty stews

description: Domaine Faiveley Burgundy is a prestigious French wine made from Pinot Noir grapes. It offers flavors of red berries, earth, and spice, with silky tannins and a long, nuanced finish.
food_pairing: Roast duck, coq au vin, mushroom risotto

description: Marqu√©s de C√°ceres Rioja is a classic Spanish red wine with aromas of red berries, vanilla, and spice. It has a smooth texture, balanced acidity, and a long, satisfying finish.
food_pairing: Spanish tapas, grilled lamb chops, chorizo
appetizer_pairing: Manchego cheese, cured meats, Spanish olives

description: Allegrini Amarone is a prestigious Italian wine from the Veneto region, made using the appassimento method. It offers intense flavors of dried fruit, spice, and chocolate, with a full body and velvety tannins.
food_pairing: Grilled steak, braised short ribs, aged cheeses
appetizer_pairing: Antipasto platter with cured meats and olives

description: Antinori Toscana is a classic Italian red wine blend from Tuscany, showcasing Sangiovese and other native grape varieties. It offers flavors of cherry, plum, and herbs, with a balanced acidity and smooth tannins.
food_pairing: Margherita pizza, pasta with tomato sauce, grilled vegetables

description: Tempranillo's medium body and fruity flavors, with hints of spice, make it a versatile pairing for various taco fillings, including beef, chicken, or pork.
food_pairing: Beef tacos, carnitas tacos, grilled vegetable tacos

description: Gamay Noir is a light-bodied red wine with bright acidity and flavors of red berries, making it a refreshing match for the richness of poutine.
food_pairing: Poutine, charcuterie board, roasted vegetables

description: Pinot Noir's light body and red fruit flavors, along with its vibrant acidity, make it a versatile pairing for various sushi rolls, including tuna, salmon, or vegetable options.
food_pairing: Sushi rolls (tuna, salmon, vegetable), sashimi, seafood ceviche
